description: Two Roman agricultural settlements half a kilometre apart (treated as a single site in the record). The NE settlement included a double ditched rectangular enclosure to the rear, no internal features were found but some pottery and 3 late Roman coins were identified. RSRB identifies this as a possible shrine due to the presence of a similar double ditched enclosure 7km to the north which was apparently interpreted as a shrine, but has not yet been excavated.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “NIAB, Huntingdon Road, Cambridge (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
